medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe short stature and mesomelia in an infant with Langer mesomelic dysplasia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The male infant was diagnosed with Langer mesomelic dysplasia on fetal ultrasound and remained markedly short with severe mesomelia and moderate rhizomelia at 19 months of age.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The proband has SHOX nullizygosity; family members exhibit SHOX haploinsufficiency, including a sister with idiopathic short stature and a father with mild Le Â´ri-Weill dyschondrosteosis.
medical_history.family_history: Father, mother, maternal grandmother, and sister exhibit SHOX-related skeletal features, with the father having LWDC and a short stature phenotype.
